This is only half the truth.
After the sales, comes the maintenance of the product.
Here is where TATRA ditches the nation and its Armed Forces most seriously. Once a vehicle breaks down, and this is with disturbing regularity, the company neither has the wherewithal nor the culture to resurrect that vehicle.
TATRA has not established a nationwide network of service centers despite the patronage it has received for 26 years. On most occasions, its ill equipped and poorly skilled engineers & workmen are not able to rectify faults, resulting in a very large number of vehicles remaining the road, for years!
In times of a crises, these would not be available, and defence equipment will never Reach the Spot it is intended to be taken. Instead of targeting the Army Chief, a patriot without a doubt, the nation needs to reflect and seek accountability from all such DPSUs.
The CAG would do well to audit their performance.
